Wakayama Takeshi, Toso Kodogu Meiji Taikei, 3 vol., 1978. Photos of
signatu=
res of fittings makers. Very handy (as Curran has noted) to get an
idea of =
whether your piece is close to the "accepted" sho-shin mei.

These photos a=
re cross-referenced in Haynes. Wakayama also did Toso Kodogu
Koza, 8 volume=
s (1972) and Toso Kinko Jiten (1984) which was referred to in
an earlier me=
ssage. The last is all Japanese text, no photos, and all of the
information=
 in it is included in Haynes.

Craig

on't suppose this is a 'big' guy. Am I mistaken?Why
